jpacman.model
Class Engine

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      jpacman.model.Engine

public class Engine
extends java.util.Observable

The top level state machine, which also acts as interface to the viewer (which observes the state machine) and the controller (which triggers the state machine events).

Version:
$Id: Engine.java,v 1.11 2009/01/30 14:10:24 arie Exp $
Author:
Arie van Deursen; Aug 1, 2003

Constructor Detail

Engine

public Engine()
Start a new engine with a default game using a default map. Postcondition: the game is ready to be played.

Engine

public Engine(Game g)
Start a new engine with a specific game.

Parameters:
g - Game to be used.
Method Detail

inStartingState

public boolean inStartingState()
The game has been set up, and is just waiting to get started.

Returns:
true iff game is starting.

inPlayingState

public boolean inPlayingState()
We're actually playing a game.

Returns:
true iff game is still on.

inDiedState

public boolean inDiedState()
Alas, we died after playing.

Returns:
true iff player died.

inWonState

public boolean inWonState()
Yes, we have been lucky and we won!

Returns:
true iff player has won.

inHaltedState

public boolean inHaltedState()
We're pausing a little and halted the game.

Returns:
true iff we're halted.

inGameOverState

public boolean inGameOverState()
A superstate representing having died or won.

Returns:
true iff the game is over.

invariant

protected boolean invariant()
We can be in at most one of the Engine's states.

Returns:
True if we in exactly one state.

initialize

public void initialize()
                throws GameLoadException
Initialize the game.

Throws:
GameLoadException - If the game can't be loaded.

quit

public void quit()
Stop the game if it is in a playing state.

start

public void start()
(Re)start the game, unless it is playing.

Try to move the player along a given offset.

Parameters:
dx - Horizontal offset
dy - Vertical offset.

Parameters:

dy - Vertical offset

getGuestCode

public char getGuestCode(int x,
                         int y)
The guest code at position x, y. Offered for viewers who would like to draw the board.

Parameters:
x - X coordinate
y - Y coordinate
Returns:
Type code of the guest.

Width of the board, offered for clients wishing to draw the board.

Returns:
the board's width.

the board's height.

getPlayerLastDx

public int getPlayerLastDx()
Returns:
Returns the most recent advancement of the player in the horizontal direction.

getPlayerLastDy

Returns the most recent advancement of the player in the vertical direction.
